> 
> 
> On 2017/1/14 at 8:54 PM, jd284 said:
> 
> 
> The small <abbr title="In-Situ Resource Utilization">ISRU</abbr> can make fertilizer at a decent rate.
> 

There's no <abbr title="In-Situ Resource Utilization">ISRU</abbr> part in <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS, do you mean the stock <abbr title="In-Situ Resource Utilization">ISRU</abbr>?

Is there a <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> patch to incorporate supplies into stock command modules or any other by chance?

**Edited <time datetime="2017-01-21T04:21:52Z" title="01/21/2017 04:21  AM" data-short="7 yr">January 21, 2017</time> by Motokid600**

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, Iso-Polaris said:
> 
> 
> There's no <abbr title="In-Situ Resource Utilization">ISRU</abbr> part in <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS, do you mean the stock <abbr title="In-Situ Resource Utilization">ISRU</abbr>?
> 

Yes, but only the small stock <abbr title="In-Situ Resource Utilization">ISRU</abbr>. the 1.25 m one.

> 
> 
> 5 hours ago, Jebs\_SY said:
> 
> 
> I am using <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS 0.5.19 and have the problem that it does not calculates the recyclers correct, when the ship is in the background.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Everything works well, when the ship is in the foreground. I made a quick video to show. to much supplies get used, when the ship is in the background (with enabled recyclers).
> 
> 
> 
> 
> One more thing I've noticed AFTER the video, the strange habitation calculation. All 3 Kerbals are in the Command pod, the ship has a hitchhiker storage container and three 1 person recyclers and 1500 supplies.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> So things to notice in this video:  
> 
> -the supply usage  of ~48/day instead of the announced ~20/day when the ship is in background  
> 
> -the different habitation for all 3 kerbals (vals hab and hs is frozen in the first fast forward run)  
> 
> -the EC time left "jump" while the ship was in background
> 
> 
> 
> 
> \*help\* Anyone has an idea whats wrong? Exception monitoring is on, but there were no exceptions here, no red lines top right.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> EDIT: Just recognized, that my mic got muted as I was calculating, unfortunately. I was pointing out, that the ship in the background used ~48 supplies / day, which is the same was when the recyclers are shut off. However, they were online and had power. Just the ship was in the background.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> [@RoverDude](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/105198-roverdude/)   @all
> 
> 
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 
> 
> <iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/754b1_DqI5I?feature=oembed" width="480"></iframe>
> 

The feeling is that all the issues are related and RD has confirmed over on the MKS page that they will be fixed next patch.

> 
> 
> On 1/19/2017 at 10:02 PM, RoverDude said:
> 
> 
> Thread catch up time!
> 
> 
> 
> 
> First - **Recyclers will be fixed in the next patch.**
> 

> 
> 
> 4 hours ago, rottielover said:
> 
> 
> Thank you the wiki is what I needed.   Here I was thinking that there was going to be no way to establish perm. resident colonists, but sounds like I just need the right parts....
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Leads me into a suggestion though,  maybe the colonist kerbals (those you can hire with that rating), as I understand it right now they simply raise all the colony stats.  Maybe they could be "buffed" a bit on the hab home times ?   IE if I'm a kerbal colonist recruited, I'm probably not looking to make a return to kerbin??   Not sure, it's a thought.
> 

You see must Kolonists are actually just Mars One candidates, they signed up but they hadn't really taken it seriously until they were called up and dragged across the solar system. So you colony needs some time to get established before anyone starts feeling at home. Once you've sent all the whiners home and brought in some new blood a strong community will take hold. Eventualy they'll rebel, throw away their hab timer chips and call themselves Dunians. (Once you get your kolonisation bonus up to 500% home timers will become irrelevant as long as they have at least 1 year hab time)

> 
> 
> 4 hours ago, Motokid600 said:
> 
> 
> Is there a <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> patch to incorporate supplies into stock command modules or any other by chance?
> 

I stole this from the sig of one of the mods (I think it was [@monstah](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/95210-monstah/)) but it has since been removed from their sig so impossible to find out who deserves credit. It's not perfect but does a good enough job.

[https://www.dropbox.com/s/mfmz64fdux2r7tz/someSupplies.cfg?dl=1](https://www.dropbox.com/s/mfmz64fdux2r7tz/someSupplies.cfg?dl=1)
Couldnt have asked for more, thanks so much.

**FYI - 0.5.20 is up.**  

This fixes the recycler issue ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

I'm having issues with the home timer, latest <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> mods as of now (0.5.20 LS). I recall that EVA should only reset the hab timer, however on my Minmus base it resets also home timer, on every EVA for any Kerbal, so its repeatable indefinitely. Hab and Home gets reset the moment they go on EVA and remain so on entering back the station. Should I open a GitHub ticket with this?

[before](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/136753/ksp/hometimerbefore.png)  [after](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/136753/ksp/hometimerafter.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2017-01-22T08:43:43Z" title="01/22/2017 08:43  AM" data-short="7 yr">January 22, 2017</time> by bounty123**
Yes please, and I can take a look

> 
> 
> 3 hours ago, cwal728 said:
> 
> 
> Ok sorry for the lack of detail, I have recovered them and they are back at the space center.  That is where I found out that they were listed as tourists.  Thanks for the quick replies. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
> 

Huh. Well THAT's not intended. Incidentally, I've moved my reply over to the <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS thread just for housekeeping purposes.

I don't suppose you have a save file from before you recovered those kerbals? Failing that, are you able to reproduce this bug in a KSP install with only <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> mods installed?

Ideally, if we can find a simple way to reproduce this with a minimal amount of mods, RoverDude might be able to figure out what sorts of shenanigans are going on. If we CAN'T reproduce it with only <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> mods, then we might have a mod conflict somewhere.
Easy fix.  If for some reason you end up with tourists in the AC, just launch them in a vessel and they will revert.

> 
>

> 
> Easy fix.  If for some reason you end up with tourists in the AC, just launch them in a vessel and they will revert.

Huh. I didn't think of that... ![:blush:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_embarrassed.gif ":blush:")

Whenever I open up the life support window, it starts flickering and throwing exceptions in the log - I've tested 0.5.19 (when it started for me) and 0.5.20 with no luck. I'm manually installing of the <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> mods (no <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>).

[@Tourman](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/93962-tourman/) I had that flickering you describe but for some reason it stopped. I don't know - but you could try visiting in turn every manned vessel you have in flight and at each one open the LS window. I did that to check on all my supplies timers just before the moment it seems to have stopped. Almost like an old bug needed to be refreshed out of the system on the new version. Hope it works for you - Good luck!

**Edited <time datetime="2017-01-23T12:35:48Z" title="01/23/2017 12:35  PM" data-short="7 yr">January 23, 2017</time> by monstah**

<abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS brought my sandbox KSS to a new dimension, but, my <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> Life Support Tank is running low on supplies. Is there any way I can use <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> to refill the tank?

> 
> 
> 7 minutes ago, jackalope50 said:
> 
> 
> <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS brought my sandbox KSS to a new dimension, but, my <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> Life Support Tank is running low on supplies. Is there any way I can use <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr> to refill the tank?
> 

Supplies work like any other resource. You should send a supply ship with more. Once docked with your KSS transfer supplies from the resupply craft into the tank on your KSS just like you would with fuel.

>

> 

If I had to guess Better Crew Assignments or (less likely imo) Diverse Kerbal Heads those were the only 2 mods I could think of which mess with kerbals.  I have uninstalled both and will run out the clock in a few to see.

EDIT: I found a way to fix the problem.  I went into my save file described on the wiki [here](http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Tutorial:Modifing_Kerbals) to change my guys back to what they were (they were all scientists so it was easy).
